newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's SCT releases long-distance guidelines.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's SCT releases long-distance guidelines.

text.p: The Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) unveiled on Wednesday guidelines for government departments to follow when selecting carriers in Mexico's recently deregulated long distance telephone department.

"Contracting shall be done following a restricted invitation procedure, with the participation of each and every carrier with a concession in the public telecommunications network that includes long-distance services," the SCT said in Wednesday's edition of the Mexican Official Gazette.
The SCT added that "the contract will be awarded in favor of whichever concessionary offers the lowest price."

Bids may be called for as of May 8, by all federal government offices in areas where the long-distance market has been opened to competition, such as Monterrey, Guadalajara, Queretaro and Mexico City.

The guidelines do not cover local telephone carriers, cellular telephones, cable television, pay television, individual and fleet paging, private or maritime radio communication or private band radio.
